== Tutorial: Using Easy Mock and JUnit
=== Create project and classes
Create a new Java Project called _com.vogella.testing.easymock.first_ . Create the following classes.
<xi:include xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" parse="text" href="./examples/easymock/Position.java[] ----
<xi:include xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" parse="text" href="./examples/easymock/ICalcMethod.java[] ----
<xi:include xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" parse="text" href="./examples/easymock/IncomeCalculator.java[] ----
The `IncomeCalculator` class should be tested. The class has the purpose to calculate the salary of a person based on the provided method and position. Obviously the test depends on the provided methods.
=== Create tests
Create a new `test` source folder in your project.
Create a new test for `IncomeCalculator` and place the new test class in this folder.
<xi:include xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" parse="text" href="./examples/easymock/IncomeCalculatorTest.java[] ----
After execution of the test you can call the `verify` method to check if the mock object was called as defined.
